nodes.bodyText: I think just Regulates whether fire should spread in a world. would be better. The field's type already tells us it's a GameRule, the comment should just describe what we can't see from its type or name.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,53 @@
 CLASS net/minecraft/class_1928 net/minecraft/world/GameRules
+	FIELD field_19387 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313;
+		COMMENT A GameRule which regulates whether fire should spread in a world.

nodes.bodyText: I'd either have these say {@link GameRule} or game rule
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,53 @@
 CLASS net/minecraft/class_1928 net/minecraft/world/GameRules
+	FIELD field_19387 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313;
+		COMMENT A GameRule which regulates whether fire should spread in a world.

nodes.bodyText: occurring
You should use {@link} here instead of {@linkplain} as they are code names, not plain text. You don't call them "GameRules" but "game rules" when you're not talking about the class.
Or {@linkplain GameRule game rule}

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		COMMENT <li>Whether explosions from a Creeper destory blocks
          
          
            
            		COMMENT <li>Whether explosions from a Creeper destroy blocks

Redundant information? You'd naturally expect a rule change to propagate when needed
This is one of the few rules that propagates a change, so it is mentioned.
Redundant information unless you were to list all restrictions, which is impossible as mods could add restrictable information too
So I'd then mention the cases in vanilla

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,39 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1928 net/minecraft/world/GameRules + FIELD field_19388 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313; + COMMENT A {@linkplain GameRule game rule} which regulates whether mobs can modify the world. + COMMENT + COMMENT

Generally one is expected to test this rule before an entity modifies the world. + COMMENT + COMMENT

In vanilla, this includes: + COMMENT

    + COMMENT
  • Whether creeper explosions destroy blocks + COMMENT
  • Whether a zombie can break down a door + COMMENT
  • Whether a wither killing an entity will place or drop a wither rose + COMMENT
+ FIELD field_19389 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313; + COMMENT A {@linkplain GameRule game rule} which regulates whether player inventories should be persistent through respawning. + FIELD field_19390 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313; + COMMENT A {@linkplain GameRule game rule} which regulates whether mobs can spawn naturally. + FIELD field_19391 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313; + COMMENT A {@linkplain GameRule game rule} which regulates whether mobs should drop loot on death. + FIELD field_19392 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313; + COMMENT A {@linkplain GameRule game rule} which regulates whether items should be dropped when a block is broken. + FIELD field_19401 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313; + COMMENT A {@linkplain GameRule game rule} which regulates whether clients' debug info is reduced. + COMMENT + COMMENT

When the value of this rule is changed, all connected clients will be notified how much debug info to display. + COMMENT In vanilla, this includes the visiblity of coordinates on the client's the DebugHud. + FIELD field_19405 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313; + COMMENT A {@linkplain GameRule game rule} which regulates the number of entities that can be crammed into a block space before they incur cramming damage. + FIELD field_19409 Lnet/minecraft/class_1928$class_4313; + COMMENT A {@linkplain GameRule game rule} which regulates whether a player advancements should be announced in chat.
